alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 12 at 3:18AM CST until December 15 at 12:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Could Bring Impacts Mid-Week... .A strong winter storm will affect northern Wisconsin for much of the week. Precipitation will move in Tuesday night as a wintry mix and a period of ice accumulation is looking more likely. The freezing rain and ice should transition to snow Wednesday. Winds will be gusting in the 35 to 45 mph range, which could cause power outages if ice does accumulate on power lines. Travel could be hazardous by Wednesday morning. This forecast is very sensitive to temperatures, which will be right near freezing. If temperatures warm a few degrees above freezing, icing will be reduced. Stay tuned to updates on this potentially hazardous weather. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to one quarter of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel could be hazardous. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
